website_summaries.verdict: The Beyerdynamic DT 880 Pro headphones deliver an accurate, powerful listening experience intended for musicians, sound engineers, and music lovers with stereo systems.
pros: Semi-open design provides wonderful sense of space

customer_reviews.title: Sound: good, but beware leakage
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality was good, but if you are choosing these over the DT990's because they are less "open-backed" be careful. I found they still leak a lot of sound. This would be an issue if - You need to share the room with other people - You want to monitor home recording I was advised to consider this range by people who assumed I'd be using them to mix music. I sent mine back and bought some DT770's instead which are better for sound leakage. Given these cost around 40% more than the 770 or 990 Pro models, make sure you check your requirements before choosing them.
customer_reviews.author: Colin_M

customer_reviews.title: No bad, but not excellent.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these after a recommendation by a friend as an alternative to my Senheisser HD650s. The build quality is excellent; more solid than the HD650 and they don't require quite as much power to drive them. My only criticism is that they tend to emphasise the treble and are a little lacking in the bass department and do not compare particularly well to the sound from a decent pair of speakers. Overall a great pair of headphones, but after a while I found myself reverting to the Sennheiser.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Snell

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous headphones but annoying heavy coiled cable.
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful high quality headphones but let down by the heavy coiled cable - although it doesn't tangle, it's annoying when working at a desk wearing them. Yamaha A-S501 drives them nicely and the sound is natural and well balanced. There's sufficient weight to the bass and enough sparkle in the highs. Good for music production / mixing etc. and also nice for casual listening.
customer_reviews.author: St. Francis of Assisi

customer_reviews.title: Extremely comfortable even with glasses
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are the most comfortable ones I have ever experienced, I am able to wear them for 8+ hours without them becoming uncomfortable. they have a snug fit on my head but it's not overly tight even though I wear glasses. The sound is fairly flat but has an emphasis on the treble but don't expect lots of bass.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Good headphones but some limitations
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable 'phones and decent quality sound on the smooth side which is fine, they are well balanced. Only downside is they can't take any real power input. I have a standard 60 watt amp and at higher volumes the 'phones start to obviously breakdown. but if it's a phone or tablet you are using these will be more than adequate.
customer_reviews.author: Simon Nicholls

customer_reviews.title: My favourite headphones
customer_reviews.text: I had both DT 770 Pro and DT 990 Pro, but these headphones are the best. Audio quality outperforms the DT 990 and sound insulation is good enough and doesn't make your ears boil when it is a hot day (one of the issues of DT 770). I mostly do classical music and this is a very good model for such type of performance.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: excellent for studio producer/ engineer
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are excellent - very comfortable and with a clear revealing and well balanced sound. They are used for the engineer/ producer in a studio and so are worn for extended periods and for detailed listening. They are also enclosed so can be worn when overdubbing without noticeable spill. Although not used routinely for mixing, mixes do translate well when checked afterwards on studio monitors. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great Headphones for the Studio
customer_reviews.text: These were bought as a replacement as my old set got accidentally damaged, had to replace them immediately and it was only slightly more expensive than getting them repaired. Been happy with these for years and very comfortable wearing for long periods of time.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Still

customer_reviews.title: Excellent studio headphones
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for some studio monitor headphones to compliment my AKG 702's for studio work and mixing. Not only do they seem to perform better than my old HD650s, these headphones are much better at producing bass frequencies than the AKGs at the expense of a slightly tighter soundstage and slightly firmer ear cushions. Would highly recommend to any studio producers and mixers.
customer_reviews.author: Hannibal Smiff

customer_reviews.title: Barely can hear anything
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure if the pair I have is just broken initially but they've been very low from day 1 and compared to different types of headphones seemed very low. Especially can feel during recording, if the headphones just on splitter, can't hear anything on those but any other headphones double of volume. For a long time I thought I am using them wrong, but I probably should have just returned those.
customer_reviews.author: Cliente Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Why the change in price?
customer_reviews.text: This really works for me as i am making a audiobook/radio play. I was just about to buy a third as I purchased two a few months ago, but now the price has gone soaring from £147. WHY? This means I will not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones
customer_reviews.text: I bought these headphones for my son at Christmas and he thinks they're great. Very good quality sound and comfortable to wear. Very pleased and can recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Shari

customer_reviews.title: Good sound and nice build quality
customer_reviews.text: These headphones sound very nice. I find a lot of headphones can be overly generous in the low-end department. These headphones are natural sounding with a very nice, accurate sound stage. Build quality is good also. These headphones have been in use for a few months now and defiantly sound better after a few hours of listening so don't panic if they sound overly bright when you first put them on. I have found they mellow out a little.
customer_reviews.author: david.lpower

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant
customer_reviews.text: Really comfy for long session and good flat sound for mixing
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: FIRST CLASS SOUND
customer_reviews.text: Everything excellent, with the exception of the connecting lead which is a little weak.
customer_reviews.author: Dee's

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: These really are superb studio headphones as they have as close a neutral sound as you can get comfort wise they are perfect as thwy completley cover the ear allowing for hours of comfortable use.
customer_reviews.author: dean giff

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect apart from curly cord
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones for music production, but coiled lead is awkward when wearing an instrument
customer_reviews.author: B. Halstead

customer_reviews.title: Transparency
customer_reviews.text: Honestly 👌🏻 incredibe. If your looking for transparent headphones, aiding to balance the lows and hi's. So unlike many headphones, they don't lie to you, you hear what your producing. Perfect for mixing and mastering.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Good build, comfy and individual parts are replaceable, so you don't have to buy another pair of headphones when a part is damaged. You'll need a decent amp if you're using them with your phone.
customer_reviews.author: solomon

customer_reviews.title: Great - very flat for price - not for those ...
customer_reviews.text: Great - very flat for price - not for those who want an 'exciting' listen - these tell it as it is - I use them on my laptop and iphone too, and they are quiet without a preamp, but give me the level I need for basic mixing, referencing - even mastering, as long as your checking on monitors too.
customer_reviews.author: Giacomo A Trivelli

customer_reviews.title: Impresive sound
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic sound quality. DT880 pro are realy impresive. Price is not to high but quality is on high end level. 880 it's old Bayers model but it is like old whisky. ;) I would like buy anther pair for my son.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely phenomenal headphones! Crystal clear sound with accurate lowend. They're also really comfortable. Only thing I don't like is the coiled cable.
customer_reviews.author: Samppa

customer_reviews.title: Best in its class
customer_reviews.text: My favourite headphones by a mile when it comes to price quality / ratio.
customer_reviews.author: Nuno Dias

customer_reviews.title: Peerless for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great for mixing or listening. Very flat response. Really love these headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Guy Incognito

customer_reviews.title: Nice headphone. Worth the price as long as you ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice headphone. Worth the price as long as you have a capable source.
customer_reviews.author: Zhang Chen

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality really good but they can't handle metal music at all
customer_reviews.text: The build quality is simply stellar, the materials, the execution. Sound quality really good but they can't handle metal music at all, sound is to thin, bass lacks impact and body for that type of music. Metal heads stay away. Otherwise cracking headphones.
customer_reviews.author: tommie_boi

customer_reviews.title: Quality Gear
customer_reviews.text: A fantastic pair of headphones for referencing/ monitoring, recording and mixdown music at studio quality! Very comfortable for long studio usage too!
customer_reviews.author: jason peters

customer_reviews.title: If your after fashion style Beats cans then walk away these are for grown ups.
customer_reviews.text: Lovely comfortable cans for sound design or gaming late at night with a nice wide sound stage and extremely detailed mid and top end with the only trade off being the slightly crappy sub bass response.
customer_reviews.author: Attacked by Badgers

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Really comfortable, Great quality, everything you expect from Beyerdynamic but nothing more
customer_reviews.author: Rowan

customer_reviews.title: beyerdynamic dt880 pro headset earphones
customer_reviews.text: my son who is a musician, is over the moon with his headphones, which were abirthday present. he is a sound engineer and his teachers recommended them. ace
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Linda Weir

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones, but not the 'Pro' version
customer_reviews.text: The headphones are very high quality - I've always bought Beyers. However, I didn't receive the Pro version (stronger headband) when I ordered, and received the normal version instead. It didn't matter to me particularly, but it might to you.
customer_reviews.author: Edward

customer_reviews.title: Stunners
customer_reviews.text: Advice on these headphones. Plug in , put music on and press play. Allow yourself to be transported to some faraway planet,FANTASTIC!
customer_reviews.author: noddy

customer_reviews.title: musicmatter.co.uk & amazon.co.uk TOP NOTCH!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: STAFF & MANAGEMENT FROM AMAZON AND MUSICMATTER ,I THANK YOU VERY MUCH FOR SENDING ME THE ORDER IN VERY GOOD CONDITION AND EARLIER. I KNOW ABOUT AUDIO BUT I JUST WANT TO BE STRAIGHT, GREAT STUDIO REF. HEADPHONES. BUY THEM WITHOUT THINKING TWICE! THANK YOU AMAZON AND MUSICMATTER!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ritter Der Nacht

customer_reviews.title: bought as a gift.
customer_reviews.text: bought as a gift on behalf of a friend. They love them & say that the headphones are very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Soggy1966

customer_reviews.title: Comfort and great sound
customer_reviews.text: These are excellent semi-open back headphones with amazingly neutral audio. The comfort level is beyond anything I’ve used before. As they are semi-open noise cancellation is not their purpose. For that choose the beyerdynamic DT - 770 closed back. Similarly, for mixing choose the DT-990 open back model. For my purposes, singing in a recording studio vocal booth, the DT-880 has been superb.
customer_reviews.author: Dwight L. Wilcox, II

customer_reviews.title: Broken within 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Paid a ridiculous amount of money for these, then one side stops working within a few months. Company said they would ship a part out that we would have to repair ourselves. Safe to say now almost 2 years later it's not in the mail. Also have received no response from company when trying to follow up about this. Please read the other reviews like this, I ignored them because of all the 5 stars and now I wish I didn't.
customer_reviews.author: Rsquared

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for detailed mixdowns.
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THESE... superbly well detailed and comfy enough to be worn for hours. After years of having my own large scale music studio, due to extensive travelling I need to use these primarily for detailed mixodwns of music that I'm working on, while in hotel rooms and other spaces that aren't my controlled studio ... and the results sound great on on other systems. Between these and my closed back Focal Pro's I am getting top quality mixes I didn't think were possible on headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Sam S

customer_reviews.title: I needed a headphone amp for these
customer_reviews.text: Some folks are posting that an amp is not needed for these. I think it's entirely dependent on what's driving them. For me, driving them off my HP Omen computer or my audio interface that I use for recording, these headphones were TERRIBLE. Very low sound output. Distorted, mid-range heavy response. I picked up a Fiio K3 and they now sound great. Can't get to ear shattering levels with that amp, but then I'm using these headphones for mixing and mastering so I don't really want that anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Extremely accurate and durable!
customer_reviews.text: I decided to purchase these headphones a few days ago and just received them in the mail yesterday. I've been mixing for about 5 years now, and I can tell you that these headphones have a very flat and accurate frequency response. The first thing I noticed is that they don't exaggerate the sub-bass frequencies, like most consumer-grade headphones in the same price range. I'm upgrading from the commonly used Sony MDR 7506s. Keep in mind that the impedance on these Beyerdynamic's is 250 ohms, so a headphone amp or professional audio interface will be needed to push them into higher amplitudes.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen B.

customer_reviews.title: the sound quality, definition, and staging of these ...
customer_reviews.text: the sound quality, definition, and staging of these headphones is second to none. they are superb, really. the only negatives i could list are that they are heavy, but that's to be expected with large magnets. and my last critique would be the exposed wire between the headphones and the headband - each time i take them off or adjust them, or put them on, my thumbs or fingers press against them. i'm concerned this might cause them issue over time.
customer_reviews.author: Evigan

customer_reviews.title: A wonderfully balanced and clear natural sound
customer_reviews.text: A wonderfully balanced and clear natural sound. I own both the 770's and 990's as well, all serve their intended sound well, but these are by far the best balanced with the clearest mids and a natural soundstage for instrumental/vocal/analytical listening. Maybe I'm becoming an old man but these are quickly becoming my favorites (the 990s hold a high spot though as well).
customer_reviews.author: Pro-te-an

customer_reviews.title: Great set of headphones, clamp is a little tight and wears out the pads by squishing them
customer_reviews.text: I love these headphones. I must not be bothered too much by the treble these are said to have. I use them with a Shiit modi/magni setup for gaming and they do great. My one complaint is that the clamp on the headphones wears out the pads over time and those replacement pads can be pricey.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Penny
customer_reviews.text: Oh man, these phones are so sweet, especially once they are broken in properly, which means a MINIMUM of fifty hours. I ran mine non stop at listening volume for three days. I originally got a set of Senheiser, but exchanged for these. Very comfortable, these are really nice. I wouldn't recommend the 600 Ohm, needs a lot of power to push those, the 250's are perfect with my 110 watt Onkyo.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: the 880's more for rock and they are the best in the bass dept
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for the primary reason to complete my collection of what is known as "old school" headphones. They consist of HD 650's, K 702's and now the DT 880's. The 702's are my goto Jazz phones, the 880's more for rock and they are the best in the bass dept. The 650's on those lazy classical or soft female singers. The 880's actually work good on all the genre's that I listen to. They are wonderful headphones with a good soundstage, nice air around instruments and highly recommended for all your listening pleasure. I prefer them over my 650's.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: The tones may as well have been analog the whole time
customer_reviews.text: These are by far my favorite headphones. Clear, neutral; it's very hard to tell what's real and what's coming from the speakers. They're extremely comfortable as well. My ears are pretty sensitive, plus I wear glasses, so on-ear's can be excruciating after some time, and even some over-ears I've used can hurt. I can wear these things all day (and I do) with no qualms. Highest quality over-ear open-back headphones I've ever used.
customer_reviews.author: Mason

customer_reviews.title: Price/quality maybe maybe not
customer_reviews.text: After a year of less than daily use I've grown to enjoy this product very much. Then mercury retrograde hit and in 2 months it fell apart. It still works tho hanging from it's own strings. Doubt I'll get anything from warranty. Worth a try? Maybe. Worth the buy? Maybe not. Still the best headset I've ever had.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: These are the best headphones I have found at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: These are the best headphones I have found at a reasonable price. They somehow sound a LOT better than the 32 ohm DT880. The sound is a lot more clear and balanced. I also own the DT-770 and DT990, and I have to say this DT-880 250ohm pro is my favorite. I'm pairing it with the Geek Out 1000, which is also one of the best portable DACs I've found. It's also one of the few that has enough wattage to power a high impedance like 250 ohm. You might want to check your DAC/Amp to see if it can handle 250 ohm.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable headphones I have ever own
customer_reviews.text: Most comfortable headphones I have ever own! and I have an extra large head. I was afraid of buying these cans after hearing/reading about reviews saying it needs a powerful amplifier so I hesitated and tried out 2 different headphones but none were as comfortable as these. They are not unusable without an amplifier but it helps.
customer_reviews.author: Algelenio

customer_reviews.title: A classic
customer_reviews.text: The flat response on these makes them one of the best all-arounder. The pro model is 250ohm and probably the best bang for the buck as far as buying new. Beyer offers them in 600 'premium' which has the dual sided, non-coiled cable. Unless you have an amp, the pros are just as good. Clamping are a little tighter initially but after some use, the clamp is just right. I have several phones and these by far have THE MOST comfortable pads.
customer_reviews.author: The smiley face on Amazon means A to Z -- CRAZY!

customer_reviews.title: The Best I Ever Had!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these reference headphones. I have been using Studio AKG's for the last 20 years and just got tired of the constant breaking of cables and ear pads. I also bought an AKG studio pair about a year ago and they sounded like crap. Apparently after they stopped making them in Austria the quality change remarkably. The sound of the DT-880 Pro blew me away. I'm enjoying using headphones again for checking my mixes. Just purchased an other pair of closed headphones from Beyerdyn. I couldn't be happier!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sinna Max

customer_reviews.title: very good
customer_reviews.text: I bought these headphones for use with the Mackie Onyx Blackjack 2X2 recording interface. I plugged in the Blackjack with a USB cable into my computer and it worked fine with no drivers. I then plugged the headphones into the Onyx Blackjack. I listen to iTunes mostly and it sounded excellent. I played Depeche Mode and I heard sounds I have never heard before. Many songs sounded like I was in the recording studio. The high impedance requires that you use an amplifier if you use them with a computer or an iPod. Overall, the headphones are amazing and a very good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Ernest A. Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Were quite comfortable. Even "Big Head" from silicon valley would be happy with them. Sound was good but I am not an audiophile. Bit bulky but was happy overall.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B

customer_reviews.title: Super comfy, can be worn for a few hours ...
customer_reviews.text: These compare really well against the AKG 701s. There are a lot of reviews for these cans so ill keep my short. Super comfy, can be worn for a few hours without issue. Construction is amazing, every part can be replaced. Soundstage is great Bought these hoping for more bass vs the AKGs but I couldnt hear much difference. Pushing these with a Aune T1 amp.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: I adore these headphones! I'm a musician, and I needed something comfortable for when I'm working on electronic music projects while I'm away from home, and for listening closely to recordings when analyzing them. I'm very happy with the sound quality, it's clear and warm. The earphones are padded well, so they are very soft, and they leave plenty of room around the ear. I can wear them comfortably for hours. They are easy to adjust and have a nice long cable. You should note that these are open back headphones, so there is some sound bleed.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Good Headphones
customer_reviews.text: I use these for work. I am a video psychic. These things have got good vibes and sound.
customer_reviews.author: leroy

customer_reviews.title: Best head phones!
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are one of the best ones Ive found for recording and mix down and Ive owned plenty doing studio work. I recommend these for professional work. i have several sets of these.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Rawk n roll!  Roll over Beethoven!!
customer_reviews.text: These are the real deal! Beautiful sound! Comfortable for long sessions!
customer_reviews.author: Jim and Kayla Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Really lightweight and nice
customer_reviews.text: I have Beyerdynamic DT-770 pro ( 250 ohms ) for 4 years. Comparing to this model, Beyerdynamic DT-880 pro ( 250 ohms ) : 1) Are much more lightweight 2) Sound better 3) Are semi-open, so you hear the TV that's in the same room 4) Look nicer The packaging was not as I expected. There should be a leather-like bag for headphones, but I found inside a simple bag made of fabric ( maybe waterproof ).
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Great OverEar Open Headphones
customer_reviews.text: I got the DT880 Pro 250ohm version. Super comfortable. Extremely good analytical sound reproduction. Sound signature is nicely neutral. Bass isn't as strong as DT770s, but it's pronounced, tight, and extended. Sound stage is superb. I use it for gaming, and listening to 320kbps Spotify streams while working. You literally hear everything as intended. Build quality is excellent and it's amazingly comfortable to wear... like pillows on your ears.
customer_reviews.author: Jpongin

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied!
customer_reviews.text: Best headphones for mixing and mastering under 300 Dollars. The trebs and highs are just a teensy bit exaggerated; the rest of the frequencies are superb! The pros are comfortable despite reviews, just take awhile to get used to! I have moderately large ears, and these fit me just barely but still comfortable! Bought them for 150 and I am beyond satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Simeón Peter

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones
customer_reviews.text: This ones make me very happy, great quallity sound, richer details, maybe I look crazy with the size of it, but in the end I don't care.
customer_reviews.author: Henrry

customer_reviews.title: The DT880 is easily my favorite of the bunch
customer_reviews.text: I also own the HD650, Q702, and SR325e. The DT880 is easily my favorite of the bunch.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Tang

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones
customer_reviews.text: Use them to mix and master - sounds great. Also use them to listen to records. Great.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Melnick

customer_reviews.title: Very nice headphones with great sound and comfort
customer_reviews.text: Very nice headphones with great sound and comfort. Only complaint is that for the first months of use the headphones were a bit tight, but they've loosened up since then.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Baerner

customer_reviews.title: Timeless classic
customer_reviews.text: Detailed, exceptional bass extension and treble extension, very good sound stage, close to perfectly neutral, good instrument separation, but not very transparent.
customer_reviews.author: Rhamnetin

customer_reviews.title: and now they're perfect. a bit of a budget
customer_reviews.text: wish there was a little more lower end. i also own the dt770s and i prefer them still compared to these. there is a little more airiness with these, but the lacking lower end makes it a little bit of a bummer. i paired these up with a FiiO E12, turned on the bass boost, and now they're perfect. a bit of a budget, but my ears are happy :)
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: In Love with my Phones
customer_reviews.text: I'm not as well-articulated as some of the other reviewers, and they've already said it all far better than I could have. I just wanted to add my 5-Stars on this product as well. Absolutely phenomenal sound and comfort. I honestly don't believe you could get better headphones for the price and they even beat quite a few more expensive models out there. Definitely not a shred of buyer's remorse.
customer_reviews.author: Gamer88

customer_reviews.title: Good sound, very comfortable and good build quality
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly comfortable, good for mixing, but you will need proper monitors for detailed EQing and mastering.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great balanced sound, slightly uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: I use it for mixing and feel I'm getting a clear and balanced sound, with no extreme changes when switching to near-field monitors. The only real downside for me is that I expected them to be more comfortable over long hours of use, but they're quite heavy and they slightly hurt my cheekbone and ears (from smushing them, not from loudness). Saying that, it's possible that it's just a bad fit between my personal ear and skull shape and these headphones. That's something you really can't tell before you've had a chance to use them, and certainly not when ordering over the internet. I still do use them for hours on end, it just gets a little unpleasant over time.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Simon

customer_reviews.title: BDH = Beyer Dynamic Headphones = Best Damn Headphones
customer_reviews.text: Solid headphones. After rocking the DT-770 for like 8-10 years, I have decided that Beyerdynamic is the only studio headphone I will buy, ever. Comfy as hell, durable, and amazing sound quality
customer_reviews.author: Ketatron

customer_reviews.title: so comfortable , so crisp
customer_reviews.text: absolutely love them , the small DAC /amp combo powers them "enough " for gaming ...but for music your going to want a proper setup ... they sound incredible on my Marantz receiver ... with some lossless from Tidal
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What an audiophile bargain.
customer_reviews.text: Bought the 880 250ohm headphones four years ago. Was listening to music via my peachtree nova, then switched to my IPhone 3G. Granted not the best "source" but the phones get loud and sound proud. Only complaint: the damn long cord! But I love them and would tell anyone to run not walk to get these.
customer_reviews.author: M. Cuffee

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with my decision
customer_reviews.text: I use these to listen to my favorite tunes and also for mixing audio recordings. I have very sensitive ears and I can clearly hear and dissect every instrument in a track. The DT880 Pro helped me a lot with my mixes. I less frequently have go back to my mix after I listen to the audio on other systems. It also wasn't leaking audio as much as I thought it would with my normal listening levels. Though I haven't tried yet, I think I could record my voice with this on without audio leaking problems. Very happy with my decision.
customer_reviews.author: Dok

customer_reviews.title: Legendary headphones.
customer_reviews.text: My go-to both in the studio, and listening casually. Not as much isolation as the 770s, but unless you're tracking drums, these definitely get my vote.
customer_reviews.author: Juppies

customer_reviews.title: Vastly exceeds your average headphone
customer_reviews.text: I'm not an audiophile, and don't have experience comparing these to other high-end headphones like the Sennheiser HD650. Having said that, I've listened quite extensively to these headphones, and find them to be extremely good. They reproduce sound accurately, have tremendous depth, and are extremely comfortable. Note, however, that if you're dealing with poor quality music files, you'll be missing what these headphones can do. Given that they are half the price of the HD650s, I'd say they are an excellent value and come highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Flat EQ for mixing, no amplifier required
customer_reviews.text: You don't need a headphone amplifier. I used mine on my iPod classic and MacBook Pro and I had to turn it up almost all the way but it was plenty loud. Great headphones with a flat eq and semi open cans for mixing!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice.
customer_reviews.text: These headphones sound great, much better than what I previously used in my studio. They are also comfortable, fitting around my ears instead of pressing against them. With the sound quality and the fit, I sometimes forget I'm wearing headphones and think I'm listening to my studio monitors.
customer_reviews.author: Cactus Pete

customer_reviews.title: These sound amazing
customer_reviews.text: I can not bore you with the snob type words of the audiophile but to my aging ears, well it is a purchase I was glad I made. They are comfortable as well with the velour pads.
customer_reviews.author: J. Vachon

customer_reviews.title: beautiful, affordable sound
customer_reviews.text: i think these are perfect for producers/composers on the go or who can't yet afford full-range monitors. i particularly am in love with the low-end as it's very clear, balanced, and controlled. these are a joy to use when mixing dance and hip hop (bass heavy music). along with a mono, single-driver reference speaker and a phat sub to double check your low-end, you can get some decent mixes. again, the low-end is just beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous
customer_reviews.text: I was slightly reluctant to hit buy on these as I don't have a headphone amp. I'm running them through a RME UFX and with the output sound level set at -15 dB the phones are plenty loud enough for me. So I am so glad I did - I am hearing detail in music that I am familiar with that I never knew was there, they are comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: rAC

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound.
customer_reviews.text: It's very very comfortable and has an excellent audio quality, plus, it becomes a good chance to get a home studio with no need to buy monitors, being still cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: David Bonilla

customer_reviews.title: One of the best pairs of semi open headphones you can buy
customer_reviews.text: One of the best pairs of semi open headphones you can buy. Still my pair of choice even after getting a pair of MDR7506's.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these as an upgrade to the Sennheiser HD 558 and I am thoroughly enjoying them. Playing all .flac files, the detail and clarity of the music is outstanding. Although some might say the bass is not very good, in my opinion it is just right, especially for classic rock, jazz, and folk rock. I would recommend these headphones to anyone looking for a neutral, all around well balanced headphone.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: YEEEESSSSS
customer_reviews.text: They just sound so good. It's like the artist is just whispering in your ear. They do not have a very flat response. There is a significant boost in some of the high frequencies, but they make everything sound crisp, just like a perfectly cooked marshmallow.
customer_reviews.author: Sir Connor

customer_reviews.title: ... a lot of bass but the sound quality is great still. If you really want the bass you'll ...
customer_reviews.text: They don't have a lot of bass but the sound quality is great still. If you really want the bass you'll want to try other products but overall these are a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Max Frost

customer_reviews.title: Great Headphones!!! Highly recommended =]
customer_reviews.text: From the Beyerdynamic I own the DT-770, the custom one pro's the T70p and finally got my hands on the DT-880. They DT-880 even withought being fully burnt in right now are easily the best to listen to overall. The clamp is perfect for me, T70p were too loose and the DT-770 were too tight. The soundstage is brilliant and the clarity is great. Not overpowering in the highs, lacking a little in the base ... but that's what amps are for right? :D
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Wong

customer_reviews.title: Comfy. Sound great.
customer_reviews.text: Comfy. Sound great. Feels open because it's an open air headphone.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Wong

customer_reviews.title: Balanced
customer_reviews.text: Second pair of very serious headphones I've gotten, and I must say, these are incredibly clear and precise. However I do not recommend these to people expecting them to block out noise from outside, they leak a little, but they are incredibly open backed, not a problem for me thus the 5 stars. All in all they are great headphones and they provide clear and precise bass, treble and the mids are nice and crisp for me. Definitely recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: Cole

customer_reviews.title: Love these for gaming and listening to music
customer_reviews.text: Love these for gaming and listening to music. I like the flat sound, I really can't find anything wrong with these.
customer_reviews.author: Mechanic101

customer_reviews.title: They are super accurate and work very well for PC gaming in ...
customer_reviews.text: These are my first open eared hi-impedance headphones and I have really been enjoying them paired up with my Schiit Vali. They are super accurate and work very well for PC gaming in addition to music. Would buy Beyerdynamic products again for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Miller

customer_reviews.title: GOOD
customer_reviews.text: It is a good thing.I like it very much.This is surprising, considering that the DT880 is one of the most reasonably priced of the major mid-priced headphones
customer_reviews.author: Chunlai.Xia

customer_reviews.text: Pros: Comfort, Comfort, Comfort, Comfort, Comfort These pair of cans, the fluffy velour ear-muff like pads, it's Comfort. Cons: You'll need an amp. Sounds are flat. You need an amp to drive this. Using it solely on your mobile device will yield very soft sounds, like a whisper. Sounds are flat. No 'Wow' experience, but good for easy listening.
customer_reviews.author: westin

customer_reviews.title: These are excellent
customer_reviews.text: With a Fiio E11 these cans really shine. 250 ohm means they'll need a little more power to respond correctly but they are nice and flat sounding. You can get a mix fairly close with these.
customer_reviews.author: LongtimeAmazonUser

customer_reviews.title: Excellent but the cord is too short and flimsy.
customer_reviews.text: Great sounding headphones for the AxeFx or any other psuedo-FRFR application. Very comfortable to wear, even for long periods of time. Only complaint is the cord is too short and too flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: CaG Hal

customer_reviews.title: What you hear is what you get!
customer_reviews.text: If you work with music professionally -chose these headphones. Very neutral and trustworthy when it comes to mixing. The best I've heard and to an incredible price. To me Beyerdynamic is just a quality company. I can really recommend these. Especially if you work with music. What you hear is what you get!
customer_reviews.author: Kristian Kjems

customer_reviews.title: They are different from closed-back headphones but gives that since of openness like in ear monitors
customer_reviews.text: Worked well. I would definitely say try a pair. They are different from closed-back headphones but gives that since of openness like in ear monitors create
customer_reviews.author: Mr86Ow

customer_reviews.title: Blow you away
customer_reviews.text: WOW! Best sounding headphones I have ever heard or owned. Just fantastic---especially for jazz and classical. Buy them you won't be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: None

customer_reviews.title: Amazing bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.text: These Headphones are absolutely wonderful. Beyerdynamic really does make excellent quality stuff and this is no exception. I've had mine for about a month now and they're completely broken in and insanely comfortable. The velour is as soft as the day I got it and I wear my headphones for around 6 hours a day at least. This has been one of my favorite purchases as of late.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Herrera

customer_reviews.title: Wonderfully Balanced and Transparent
customer_reviews.text: Simply put, when drive properly it is wonderfully transparent and balanced! The highs are very satisfying, the mids are lush but not forward and the bass is meaningful. Again though a very balanced can great for mastering and for enjoyment should be paired with a slightly colored amp!
customer_reviews.author: Mshenay

customer_reviews.title: A very good headphone for Home Studio
customer_reviews.text: With his large range of frequencies, I realy can mix with it. . Light and well-balanced you can enjoy it for a long time. But If you like big bass to listen your type of music, skip it !
customer_reviews.author: GLap

product_meta.title: beyerdynamic DT 880 Pro Over-Ear Studio Headphone
product_meta.description: Color:GrayThe DT 880 PRO is a reference-class, semi-open studio headphone which combines all strengths of open, transparent headphones with those of more powerful, closed headphones. Specially designed housings and an improved system equalization turn this “remake” of the studio classic DT 880 into an ideal studio monitoring headphone, with analytical qualities. Soft ear pads and adjustable, sliding, earpieces together with a single sided connecting cable ensure listening comfort during extended periods of use.
feature_bullets: Beyerdynamic DT 880 Pro Professional Studio Headphones. Semi-open, diffuse-field studio headphone. Analytical sound.
Comfortable fit due to rugged, adjustable, soft padded headband construction. Robust, easy serviceable construction as all parts are replaceable.
Single-sided cable. Velour, circum-aural (around the ear) ear pads. Supplied in a nylon carrying case. Transmission type Wired. Headphone design (operating principle) Semi-open.
Headphone design (operating principle) Semi-open. Headphone impedance 250 ohms. Headphone frequency response 5 - 35.000 Hz. Nominal sound pressure level 96 dB.
Cable & plug Coiled connecting cable with mini-jack plug (3.5 mm) & ¼“ adapter (6.35 mm). Net weight without packaging 295 g.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
